DOC.brief_summary: Anterior Cruciate Ligament ACL reconstruction can be performed under the combination of posterior lumbar plexus block plus sciatic nerve block. The investigators can have the same outcome by performing instead of posterior lumbar plexus block more peripheral nerve blocks. More specifically under the combination of sciatic nerve block plus femoral nerve block plus obturator nerve block.
DOC.brief_title: Ultrasound Guided Obturator Nerve Block for Anterior Cruciate Ligament Reconstruction (ACL)
DOC.criteria: Age 1850 years old ASA I II ACL reconstruction surgery Coagulopathy disorders Infection at the puncture site for the interscalene block Neurologic deficit in the arm that is going to be operated Allergy to local anesthetics BMI > 35 Psychiatric disorders Patient's refusal Problems with patient communication
